Package index

User Available Functions

This section contains the documentation for all functions available to the user in the SplineOmics package.

compare_results()
Compare hits between two SplineOmics results
cluster_genes_multiomics()
Gene-Centric Multi-Omics Clustering Across Blocks and Data Modalities
cluster_hits()
Cluster the significant features based on spline similarity
create_clustering_report()
Generate an HTML clustering report from precomputed results
create_limma_report()
Generate HTML report with p-value histograms of all the features
create_ora_report()
Generate an HTML report for over-representation analysis results
create_splineomics()
Create an object containing variables often used by SplineOmics functions
extract_gene_sets()
Download gene set annotations from Bioconductor organism databases
download_enrichr_databases()
Download the Enrichr databases
explore_data()
Automatically perform exploratory data analysis (EDA)
extract_data()
Extract a rectangular block from a dataframe and make it to a matrix
find_pvc()
Find peaks and valleys in time-series omics data
preprocess_rna_seq_data()
Perform essential preprocessing steps for raw RNA-seq counts
print(<SplineOmics>)
Print function for SplineOmics objects
run_ora()
Perform over-representation analysis with the results from cluster_hits()
run_limma_splines()
Perform a limma spline analysis to identify significant features
update_splineomics()
Update the variables in a SplineOmics object

Developed by Thomas Rauter.

Site built with pkgdown 2.1.3.
